channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 The New York Times Company

item.title: Dozens Feared Dead as Train Derails in Spain
item.description: A train derailed in northwestern Spain on Wednesday night, toppling passenger cars on their sides and leaving at least one torn open as smoke rose into the air. Dozens were feared dead, with possibly even more injured.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: The scene of a train derailment in Northern Spain, close to Santiago de Compostela, on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Surprising Culprit in Ivory Smuggling: Ex-U.S. Official
item.description: David McNevin, who served as a defense attaché at the American Embassy in Nairobi, was stopped at an airport last month with a little less than two pounds of ivory.
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox Candidates Elected as Israel’s Chief Rabbis
item.description: Two candidates backed by ultra-Orthodox parties were elected as Israel’s chief rabbis, defeating a rabbi who had promised, in an aggressive campaign, to transform the troubled rabbinate.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Gaza’s Economy Suffers From Egyptian Crackdown
item.description: As Egypt’s military steps up its campaign against Islamic militants in the Sinai Peninsula, the closure of tunnels into Gaza has meant hardship for Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: By FARES AKRAM
item.media:description: A clampdown has resulted in the destruction or closure of around 80 percent of the tunnels that run beneath the Egypt-Gaza border.

item.title: India Ink: A Kitchen That Prepares Lunch for Schoolchildren in Delhi
item.description: Stri Shakti, a nongovernmental organization, prepares food for about 300,000 children in New Delhi every day.
item.dc:creator: By PAMPOSH RAINA
item.media:description: Workers filling steel containers with rice at the Stri Shakti kitchen in West Delhi.

item.title: Snowden Lawyer Says No Clearance to Leave Airport
item.description: The lawyer helping Edward J. Snowden brought him clothes and a copy of “Crime and Punishment” but said more work was needed on his asylum request.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and STEVEN LEE MYERS
item.media:description: The former N.S.A. contractor Edward J. Snowden during an interview in Hong Kong in June.

item.title: The Little Prince Gets a Name: George
item.description: A day after Prince William and his wife, Kate, showed their newborn son to the world, Buckingham Palace announced his name.
item.category: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain
item.dc:creator: By JENNIFER PRESTON

item.title: U.S. Halts Delivery of F-16 Fighters to Egypt, in Sign of Disapproval
item.description: Aides say President Obama wanted to send the military-led government a signal of displeasure with the chaotic situation since Mohamed Morsi’s ouster.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER and THOM SHANKER

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: July 24
item.description: A Naga man from the Chang tribe arriving for a public rally in Tuensang town in east Nagaland.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A Naga man from the Chang tribe, arriving at a public rally in Tuensang town in east Nagaland. Several Naga tribes from the eastern part of Nagaland had organized the rally to demand the creation of a separate state.

item.title: U.S. Says Rwanda Aids Congo Rebels
item.description: Recent clashes between the M23 rebels and troops belonging to the Democratic Republic of Congo have heightened concern about reviving violence in the region.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: ArtsBeat: Presenting an Infant, and an Image
item.description: The announcement and introduction of the royal baby has been an artful display of salesmanship.
item.dc:creator: By ALESSANDRA STANLEY
item.media:description: Prince William and his wife, Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge, emerged from St Mary's Hospital on Tuesday evening with their infant son.

item.title: Lens Blog: Rugby Rehabilitation in an Argentine Prison
item.description: Generally considered a sport for Argentina’s elite class, rugby has become a source of brotherhood and hope for a team of prisoners on the outskirts of Buenos Aires.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID GONZALEZ

item.title: Principal of School That Served Tainted Lunch Is Arrested
item.description: The principal, Meena Kumari, was among the most wanted people in India after fleeing when children in her school fell ill, with 23 dying.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Children who fell sick after eating a free school lunch lay in a hospital last week in Patna, India.

item.title: Egyptian General Calls for Mass Demonstrations
item.description: The call from Gen. Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi raised the possibility of another Friday of dueling protests with supporters of deposed President Mohamed Morsi.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Glaxo Chief Executive Addresses China Probe
item.description: Andrew Witty revealed few new details about the bribery investigation of GlaxoSmithKline, but said that the company was cooperating with the Chinese government.
item.dc:creator: By KATIE THOMAS

item.title: At War Blog: The Risky Missile Systems That Syria’s Rebels Believe They Need
item.description: A potential menace to military and civilian aircraft alike, heat-seeking, shoulder-fired anti-aircraft missiles are a modern version of the proverbial sword that cuts two ways.
item.dc:creator: By C.J. CHIVERS
item.media:description: An expended SA-16 missile tube in Idlib Governorate in late May. Rebels said this weapon had been used to destroy a Syrian Air Force attack jet.

item.title: Disgraced Chinese Official May Go on Trial Soon
item.description: Bo Xilai, who was expelled from the Communist Party Politburo, is expected to face criminal charges within weeks, according to two people with knowledge of the case.
item.category: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

item.title: The Lede: Video of Clashes in Brazil Appears to Show Police Infiltrators Among Protesters
item.description: Supporters of Brazil’s protest movement and the police in Rio de Janeiro spent much of Tuesday arguing online over which side was to blame for violence at a demonstration on Monday.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY, SERGIO PEÇANHA and TAYLOR BARNES and NADIA SUSSMAN
item.media:description: A screenshot from video released by the police in Rio de Janeiro showed a masked man moments before he hurled a Molotov cocktail at officers.

item.title: Data on Factories and Lending Raise Hopes for Euro Zone Recovery
item.description: Europe may be near the end of a prolonged slump that has pushed unemployment to record highs, the survey showed, but economists predicted the upturn probably will be slow.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING
item.media:description: A new survey suggested that growth is picking up in Germany. Daimler, the maker of Mercedes cars, said that sales of passenger vehicles rose 9 percent in the quarter. Above, a Mercedes plant in Sindelfingen, Germany.

item.title: News Analysis: Asian Economies Encounter Stiff Winds
item.description: Over the last couple of months, the economic engines of developing Asia have shifted downward, and that may hurt the rest of the world.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By BETTINA WASSENER
item.media:description: Workers at a porcelain factory in Chongqing, China, this month. A new survey showed Chinese manufacturing activity in July contracted at its quickest pace since last summer.

item.title: Biden Urges Closer Cooperation With India’s Business Elite
item.description: Speaking in Mumbai, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said he sees a “historic opportunity” to improve ties, but India must open up its economy more.
item.dc:creator: By NEHA THIRANI BAGRI
item.media:description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. spoke at the Bombay Stock Exchange on Wednesday in Mumbai, India.

item.title: Letter from China: Apps Offer Chinese a Path to the Forbidden
item.description: Millions of young Chinese seem to be plunging enthusiastically into the world of social contact apps, often location-based and with a hookup element.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW

item.title: The Lede: First Video of the Prince of Cambridge
item.description: Prince William and the Duchess of Cambridge emerged from the hospital late on Tuesday and presented their infant to the crowds who had gathered outside the building for days.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER
item.media:description: Prince William and the Duchess of Cambridge appeared with their baby boy outside the Lindo Wing of St Mary's Hospital in London on Tuesday.

item.title: The Lede: Video of Deadly Violence in Cairo
item.description: Video and text accounts of the violence in Cairo Monday night posted online by witnesses.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By LIAM STACK

item.title: 3 Dead After Migrants’ Boat Capsizes on Way to Australia
item.description: The sinking comes as Australia’s prime minister, Kevin Rudd, faces scrutiny for a tough new policy toward asylum seekers.
item.dc:creator: By MATT SIEGEL
